parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have been already, have been previously. From pro and huparcho; to exist before, i.e. to be or do something previously.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Simon. Of Hebrew origin; Simon, the name of nine Israelites.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To practice sorcery or magic. From magos; to practice magic.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From ek and histemi; to put out of wits, i.e. Astound, or become astounded, insane.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.
Of Hebrew origin; Samaria, a city and region of Palestine.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
